Dear Ms. Allen-Pettway:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel, at (616) 204-
6992.

III. INVESTIGATION
1

Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12206 Staff qualifications
Section (1) An agency shall require a staff member who has ongoing
Description contact with children or parents to be a person who has the ability,
experience, education, and training to perform the duties
assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 1/23/23, a legal mother abducted their child who is a
Temporary Court ward with court ordered supervised parenting
time, from a parenting visit and left the visitation building without
permission. Law enforcement was contacted. The parenting time
specialist was observing the visit through video surveillance.
Investigation Complainant was interviewed via email on January 31, 2023.
Complainant reported she did not have any additional information
to add.
Foster care worker (FCW) was interviewed face-to-face at the
agency on February 3, 2023. FCW completed supervision
meeting and walked into her office where Parenting time (PT)
specialist was watching the parenting time. Just after returning to
her office, she observed PT specialist immediately get up and
asked aloud “where is she going” and attempt to follow Parent 1
and Youth A who had left the parenting time area and walk
towards the exit door of the suite. The initial thought was maybe
Parent 1 had taken child to use the restroom so that was the first
area that staff checked. Upon learning from PT specialist that
Parent 1 and Youth A had left the visitation she checked all floors
of the building to look for them. In addition, PT specialist and
Parent 2 were also looking for them. FCW stated Parent 1 and
Parent 2 regularly use the stairwell and not the elevators. The
camera inside the visit room does not capture any activity once
someone turns the corner. FCW stated she has observed PT
specialist during other visits and has never had any concerns that
she wasn’t adequately watching visits. FCW stated as a result of
this incident the agency is amending their procedures for
observing supervised parenting time. The observing worker will
now be seated just outside of the visitation room.
Foster Care Supervisor (FC Supervisor) was interviewed face-
to-face at the agency on February 3, 2023. The parenting time
visit started at approximately 11:45 am. She was meeting with
FCW until a little after 1pm and there had been no issues with the
parenting time up until that point. Approximately 1:15pm Parent 2
came down and asked to use the restroom which was locked. A
few minutes later FCW came and reported that PT specialist had
2

reported that Parent 1 had left with Youth A. FC Supervisor had
maintenance check the restroom looking for Parent 2 who was still
in the restroom. After discovering Parent 1 and Youth A were not
in the restroom FC Supervisor called 911. FC supervisor reviewed
building security footage with security personnel and saw Parent 1
and Youth A leave the building.
Parenting Time specialist (PT specialist) was interviewed via
telephone on February 9, 2023. PT specialist stated she was not
scheduled to observe the parenting time. She stated she ended
up observing the visit while FCW went to meet with FC
Supervisor. PT specialist stated Parent 2 was playing music on his
phone during the visit and was loud enough that it impacted the
ability to hear all of what was being said. She stated at one point
she got up to answer the door because the doorbell continued to
go off. She stated it was another client that was there for a drug
screen, so she administered the drug screen. PT specialist stated
at one point Parent 1 put Youth A’s jacket on. She stated she
wasn’t alarmed at that point because they had awhile left in the
visit. She stated Parent 1 was sitting on the floor for a while
holding Youth A who had fallen asleep. PT specialist stated that
FCW came into the office after her supervision meeting at
approximately 1:15pm. While talking to her to summarize the visit
PT specialist saw mother grab her bag that she had on the table in
the visitation room and walk out. She stated she made a
statement to FCW inquiring where Parent 1 is going and
immediately walked out of her office toward the visitation room.
She stated there was discussion about Parent 1 possibly using the
restroom. PT specialist and FCW checked different areas outside
of the suite and throughout the rest of the building and were not
able to locate Parent 1 or Youth A. PT specialist stated she was
put on administrative leave the day after the incident. On February
3, 2023, the agency terminated her employment as a result of the
incident.
Chief Administrator (CA) was interviewed via telephone on
February 21, 2023. CA stated the agency has made changes as a
result of this incident. The individual supervising visits is now
required to sit just outside of the visitation room unless their
supervisor approves an alternative.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of January 23, 2023, parenting time at Bethany
Christian Services Madison Heights satellite office in Flint.
Video was reviewed from parenting time on January 23, 2023.
Approximately halfway through the video the PT specialist comes
3

into view of the camera which is consistent with her statement she
provided a drug screen to another client that reported to the office.
Throughout the video Parent 1 and Parent 2 are observed
whispering but it is difficult to determine what is being discussed
because father plays music on his phone throughout most of the
visit and the child, at times, played with loud toys. Parent 2 can be
heard saying “you should have complied” several times. Parent 1
makes comments regarding Youth A not being fed properly and
having marks on him. Parent 1 sits on the floor while holding
Youth A who is asleep for approximately 30 minutes. Parent 1
stands up, puts her coat on, puts toys away, throws out trash,
packs her bag and leaves the room with Youth A making a right
turn, out of camera view. Within 30-35 seconds PT specialist
comes into camera view.
Tour Observation:
A tour of the facility occurred on February 3, 2023. The office
is a suite within a larger building. Upon entering the suite there is
a reception desk to the right. Kitty corner left is the supervised
visitation room. The wall on the right side of the door is floor to
ceiling glass. The area where PT specialist observes is down a
hallway approximately 40 ft. The office of FCW and PT specialist
is around a small corner to the right and FC supervisor office is to
the left. Inside the supervised visitation room is not viewable from
the back offices.
Documents Reviewed:
 Personnel file for PT Specialist. Performance Coaching
form dated 2/3/2023 references parenting time incident on
1/23/2023. Agency internal investigation determined PT
Specialist was substantiated for misconduct in the
workplace, specifically negligence impacting the well-being
of a client. She was placed on paid administrative leave on
1/24/2023 and terminated on 2/3/2023.
Analysis The agency is found in noncompliance as Parenting Time
Specialist acknowledged she, at times, did not closely monitor the
supervised parenting time and, at one point, left her desk for a
short time to assist another client.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12202 Policy and procedures
Section (1) An agency shall have and follow written policies and
Description procedures for the following:
(e) Staff responsibilities.
4

Violation Additional Finding
Type
Allegation The agency has an established procedure that includes utilizing a
Parenting Time Supervision Request form prior to Parenting Time
Specialist supervising a parenting time. On 1/23/23 the procedure
was not followed.
Investigation Parenting Time specialist (PT specialist) was interviewed via
telephone on February 9, 2023. PT specialist stated she was not
scheduled to observe the parenting time. She stated the agency
has a policy that outlines supervised visits within the first 30 days
after removal are supervised by the assigned foster care worker.
She stated this was the 2nd scheduled parenting time for this
family since removal. She stated she ended up observing the visit
while FCW went to meet with FC supervisor.
Chief Administrator (CA) was interviewed via telephone on
February 21, 2023. CA stated the agency has a written process
that outlines when a PT specialist is needed to supervise a
parenting time. CA stated she believed this particular parenting
time was on FCW’s calendar, but PT specialist ended up
supervising the visit.
Documents Reviewed:
 Parenting Time Supervision Request form. The form is
used to request Parenting Time Specialist to supervise
parenting time. Form is to be completed and provided to
PTS. Once received, the PTS will review details and
availability and report back to confirm is request can be
completed.
Analysis The agency is found in noncompliance as it was determined the
established procedure of utilizing the Parenting Time Supervision
Request form was not followed.
Conclusion Violation Established
5

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
